title: Gross Domestic Product (Euro/ECU series) for Euro area (EA11-2000, EA12-2006, EA13-2007, EA15-2008, EA16-2010, EA17-2013, EA18-2014, EA19)
notes:
Eurostat unit ID: CP_MEUR
Eurostat item ID = B1GQ
Eurostat country ID: EA

Euro/ECU series is expressed in euro from January 1, 1999 till present. Prior to December 31, 1998, synthetic exchange rate of the national currency to European Community Unit (ECU) is used to adjust for market exchange rate movements.

Evolution of the Euro Area
EA11 (January 1, 1999 - December 31, 2000): Austria, Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, and Spain
EA12 (January 1, 2001 - December 31, 2006): Greece + Austria, Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, and Spain
EA13 (January 1, 2007 - December 31, 2007): Slovenia + Austria, Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, and Greece
EA15 (January 1, 2008 - December 31, 2008): Cyprus and Malta + Austria, Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Greece, and Slovenia
EA16 (January 1, 2009 - December 31, 2010): Slovakia + Austria, Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Greece, Slovenia, Cyprus, and Malta
EA17 (January 1, 2011 - December 31, 2013): Estonia + Austria, Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Greece, Slovenia, Cyprus, Malta, and Slovakia
EA18 (January 1, 2014 - December 31, 2014): Latvia + Austria, Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Greece, Slovenia, Cyprus, Malta, Slovakia, and Estonia
EA19 (from January 1, 2015): Lithuania + Austria, Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Greece, Slovenia, Cyprus, Malta, Slovakia, Estonia, and Latvia
